summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and attorneys from The Bloom Firm, coordinating interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004. The emails discuss scheduling in-person and video conference interviews and mention the submission of photographs for identification.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Primary attorney from The Bloom Firm corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office to schedule interviews for two clients alleging assault by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney at The Bloom Firm copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling of client interviews.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney with The Bloom Firm who is noted as accompanying one of the clients to her in-person interview.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Attorney at The Bloom Firm copied on the email correspondence regarding the scheduling of client interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)); the individual whom the clients allege assaulted them.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at The Bloom Firm working on the case for clients alleging assault by Jeffrey Epstein.
Both are attorneys at The Bloom Firm; Fudali is noted as the New York attorney who will accompany a client to an interview.
Both are attorneys at The Bloom Firm copied on the scheduling correspondence.
Gibbs is representing clients who are alleged victims of Epstein in the criminal case.
Fudali is an attorney representing an alleged victim of Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Interview for Victim 1
events.description: An in-person interview is scheduled at the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York for one of the alleged victims, to be accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference for Victim 2
events.description: A video conference interview is scheduled for a second alleged victim who is located in a different time zone.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: The document references that the firm's clients believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, represented by The Bloom Firm, came forward in August 2019, alleging assaults in or around June 2004.
Interviews with the victims were scheduled with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for late August 2019.
The Bloom Firm attorneys submitted photographs of the clients from 2004 to the prosecution to see if they were in any photos seized from Epstein's home.
The email chain shows coordination between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors shortly after Epstein's arrest in July 2019 (case 19 Cr. 490).
One victim was traveling from Maryland for an in-person interview, while the other was scheduled for a video conference due to location/time zone differences.
